intro: Lepidadenia hirta, commonly known as the hairy lepidadenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Lepidadenia hirta is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
